Peeking values are responsive and support CSS units

props.code:
<ssr-carousel
  :slides-per-page="2"
  paginate-by-slide
  loop
  peek="10%"
  feather
  :responsive="[
    {
      maxWidth: 767,
      gutter: 10,
      peek: 20
    }
  ]"
>
  <slide :index="1"></slide>
  <slide :index="2"></slide>
  <slide :index="3"></slide>
</ssr-carousel>

prop uses your gutter value for the prop. This is useful setting when your
instance is flush with the edges of your browser and you use your site gutter value; the slides will transition out the edge of the page. Then, use the
to automatically add a light feathering mask when the viewport is wider than the carousel width.

props.code:
<ssr-carousel
  :slides-per-page="3"
  paginate-by-slide
  loop
  peek-gutter
  gutter="var(--fluid-gutter)"
  :responsive="[
    {
      minWidth: 1440,
      feather: 'calc(var(--fluid-gutter) * 0.5)'
    },
    {
      maxWidth: 768,
      slidesPerPage: 2
    },
    {
      maxWidth: 500,
      slidesPerPage: 1
    }
  ]"
>
  <slide :index="1"></slide>
  <slide :index="2"></slide>
  <slide :index="3"></slide>
  <slide :index="4"></slide>
  <slide :index="5"></slide>
</ssr-carousel>
<style lang="scss">
body {
  --fluid-gutter: 40px, 20px;
}
</style>
